title: Two kids, two women injured during shooting on Cleveland's West Side
content:
CLEVELAND, Ohio -- Two kids and two women suffered injuries during a shooting late Monday.
The two kids -- ages 9 and 14 -- and two women-- ages 32 and 34-- are expected to recover after being treated at MetroHealth Medical Center.
The shooting happened about 10 p.m. on West 107th Street near Lorain Avenue.
A woman went outside a house in the area as she argued with her boyfriend. A man came out of the house and fired several gunshots at the boyfriend, police said. Both men ran.
Police found five bullet casings from two different guns.
The 9-year-old boy and 14-year-old girl were both shot in the legs. A 34-year-old woman suffered a gunshot wound to the back. A 32-year-old woman was grazed in the back by a bullet.
Police said it appears ricocheting bullets caused some of the injures.
Investigators have a suspect and will release his identity once charges are filed.
